intro: Euphrasia montana var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
